publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-853 Irene Oldfather: Marymass Festival, Irvine-That the Parliament notes with regret the omission of Irvine's Marymass festival from the Scottish Tourist Board's "What's On Scotland" list; commends the Irvine Carters' Society and festival committee for its work in organising and promoting the festival; welcomes the proposed programme for this year's festival, celebrating Irvine's heritage and community spirit; and calls upon the Scottish Tourist Board to rectify this error by funding additional publicity for the festival.
S1M-853 Marymass Festival, Irvine (lodged on 12 May 2000) Robin Harper*, Michael Russell*
S1M-853 Marymass Festival, Irvine (lodged on 12 May 2000) Shona Robison*

S1M-853 Irene Oldfather: Marymass Festival, Irvine—That the Parliament notes with regret the omission of Irvine’s Marymass festival from the Scottish Tourist Board’s "What’s On Scotland" list; commends the Irvine Carters’ Society and festival committee for its work in organising and promoting the festival; welcomes the proposed programme for this year’s festival, celebrating Irvine’s heritage and community spirit; and calls upon the Scottish Tourist Board to rectify this error by funding additional publicity for the festival. Supported by: Robin Harper, Michael Russell, Shona Robison
S1M-853 Marymass Festival, Irvine (lodged on 12 May 2000) Margaret Jamieson*, Andrew Wilson*
S1M-853 Marymass Festival, Irvine (lodged on 12 May 2000) Mr Kenneth Gibson*

S1M-853 Irene Oldfather: Marymass Festival, Irvine—That the Parliament notes with regret the omission of Irvine’s Marymass festival from the Scottish Tourist Board’s "What’s On Scotland" list; commends the Irvine Carters’ Society and festival committee for its work in organising and promoting the festival; welcomes the proposed programme for this year’s festival, celebrating Irvine’s heritage and community spirit; and calls upon the Scottish Tourist Board to rectify this error by funding additional publicity for the festival. Supported by: Robin Harper, Michael Russell, Shona Robison, Margaret Jamieson, Andrew Wilson, Mr Kenneth Gibson
S1M-853 Marymass Festival, Irvine (lodged on 12 May 2000) Alex Neil*

S1M-853 Irene Oldfather: Marymass Festival, Irvine-That the Parliament notes with regret the omission of Irvine's Marymass festival from the Scottish Tourist Board's "What's On Scotland" list; commends the Irvine Carters' Society and festival committee for its work in organising and promoting the festival; welcomes the proposed programme for this year's festival, celebrating Irvine's heritage and community spirit; and calls upon the Scottish Tourist Board to rectify this error by funding additional publicity for the festival. Supported by: Robin Harper, Michael Russell, Shona Robison, Margaret Jamieson, Andrew Wilson, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Alex Neil
S1M-853 Marymass Festival, Irvine (lodged on 12 May 2000) Mr Murray Tosh*

S1M-853 Irene Oldfather: Marymass Festival, Irvine-That the Parliament notes with regret the omission of Irvine's Marymass festival from the Scottish Tourist Board's "What's On Scotland" list; commends the Irvine Carters' Society and festival committee for its work in organising and promoting the festival; welcomes the proposed programme for this year's festival, celebrating Irvine's heritage and community spirit; and calls upon the Scottish Tourist Board to rectify this error by funding additional publicity for the festival. Supported by: Robin Harper, Michael Russell, Shona Robison, Margaret Jamieson, Andrew Wilson, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Alex Neil, Mr Murray Tosh, Phil Gallie*
S1M-853 Marymass Festival, Irvine (lodged on 12 May 2000) Cathy Jamieson*

S1M-853 Irene Oldfather: Marymass Festival, Irvine—That the Parliament notes with regret the omission of Irvine’s Marymass festival from the Scottish Tourist Board’s "What’s On Scotland" list; commends the Irvine Carters’ Society and festival committee for its work in organising and promoting the festival; welcomes the proposed programme for this year’s festival, celebrating Irvine’s heritage and community spirit; and calls upon the Scottish Tourist Board to rectify this error by funding additional publicity for the festival. Supported by: Robin Harper, Michael Russell, Shona Robison, Margaret Jamieson, Andrew Wilson, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Alex Neil, Mr Murray Tosh, Phil Gallie, Cathy Jamieson

S1M-853 Irene Oldfather: Marymass Festival, Irvine—That the Parliament notes with regret the omission of Irvine’s Marymass festival from the Scottish Tourist Board’s "What’s On Scotland" list; commends the Irvine Carters’ Society and festival committee for its work in organising and promoting the festival; welcomes the proposed programme for this year’s festival, celebrating Irvine’s heritage and community spirit; and calls upon the Scottish Tourist Board to rectify this error by funding additional publicity for the festival. S1M-853 Irene Oldfather: Marymass Festival, Irvine—That the Parliament notes with regret the omission of Irvine’s Marymass festival from the Scottish Tourist Board’s "What’s On Scotland" list; commends the Irvine Carters’ Society and festival committee for its work in organising and promoting the festival; welcomes the proposed programme for this year’s festival, celebrating Irvine’s heritage and community spirit; and calls upon the Scottish Tourist Board to rectify this error by funding additional publicity for the festival.
